page.title: Human rights in Egypt under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.diff:
Line 18: Line 18:
Another activist that has been detained is Loai Nagati.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> The [[We are all Khaled Said|We Are All Khaled Said]] Facebook page said: "Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist who got arrested during Tahrir protests yesterday morning. As it has become the norm now, Loai has been sent to 15 days in a military jail awaiting a military investigation! Loai didnât have a lawyer, has no clear accusation against him & is a computer science student. He is a civilian & shouldnât be investigated by military prosecuters. End military trials of civilians in Egypt NOW! 45 protesters have been arrested so far during Tahrir protests on 28 June night & 29 June morning. All sent to military trials."<ref>{{cite web|title=Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist|url=http://liveword.ca/egypt/2011/06/30/24076/|publisher=http://liveword.ca/|accessdate=2 July 2011}}</ref> An active Tweeter, Nagati was Tweeting (@LoaiNagati) from Tahrir Square about what was taking place when he was arrested. âSeveral people are injured,â was the last tweet by Nagati at 7am on Wednesday.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> Nagati is to be detained for 15 days and was transferred on June 29 to military prison pending a military trial.<ref name="elbadil1">{{cite news|title=Ø´ÙÙÙ ÙØ¤Ù ÙØ¬Ø§ØªÙ ÙØ¹ØªÙÙ Ø§ÙØ³Ø¬Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø±Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙÙØ±ÙØ¶ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙÙØ¨: ÙÙØ¹ÙÙÙ ÙÙ Ø¥Ø¯Ø®Ø§Ù Ø£Ø¯ÙÙØ© ÙÙ ÙØ·Ø§ÙØ¨ØªÙÙ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙØ¨Ø¶ Ø¹ÙÙ ÙØ£Ø¯Ø®Ù Ø§ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø¡|url=http://elbadil.net/%D8%B4%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82-%D9%84%D8%A4%D9%8A-%D9%86%D8%AC%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%AA%D9%82%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%AC%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B1/|accessdate=2 July 2011|newspaper=http://elbadil.net/|date=1 July 2011}}</ref> Nagati has a heart condition as well as digestive problems which require 10 different medications, and after some struggle, an officer who works at the prison agreed to the transfer of the medication to Nagati.<ref name="elbadil1"/>
Another activist that has been detained is Loai Nagati.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> The [[We are all Khaled Said|We Are All Khaled Said]] Facebook page said: "Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist who got arrested during Tahrir protests yesterday morning. As it has become the norm now, Loai has been sent to 15 days in a military jail awaiting a military investigation! Loai didnât have a lawyer, has no clear accusation against him & is a computer science student. He is a civilian & shouldnât be investigated by military prosecuters. End military trials of civilians in Egypt NOW! 45 protesters have been arrested so far during Tahrir protests on 28 June night & 29 June morning. All sent to military trials."<ref>{{cite web|title=Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist|url=http://liveword.ca/egypt/2011/06/30/24076/|publisher=http://liveword.ca/|accessdate=2 July 2011}}</ref> An active Tweeter, Nagati was Tweeting (@LoaiNagati) from Tahrir Square about what was taking place when he was arrested. âSeveral people are injured,â was the last tweet by Nagati at 7am on Wednesday.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> Nagati is to be detained for 15 days and was transferred on June 29 to military prison pending a military trial.<ref name="elbadil1">{{cite news|title=Ø´ÙÙÙ ÙØ¤Ù ÙØ¬Ø§ØªÙ ÙØ¹ØªÙÙ Ø§ÙØ³Ø¬Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø±Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙÙØ±ÙØ¶ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙÙØ¨: ÙÙØ¹ÙÙÙ ÙÙ Ø¥Ø¯Ø®Ø§Ù Ø£Ø¯ÙÙØ© ÙÙ ÙØ·Ø§ÙØ¨ØªÙÙ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙØ¨Ø¶ Ø¹ÙÙ ÙØ£Ø¯Ø®Ù Ø§ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø¡|url=http://elbadil.net/%D8%B4%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82-%D9%84%D8%A4%D9%8A-%D9%86%D8%AC%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%AA%D9%82%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%AC%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B1/|accessdate=2 July 2011|newspaper=http://elbadil.net/|date=1 July 2011}}</ref> Nagati has a heart condition as well as digestive problems which require 10 different medications, and after some struggle, an officer who works at the prison agreed to the transfer of the medication to Nagati.<ref name="elbadil1"/>
  +   +
[[Asmaa Mahfouz]] was arrested on charges of defaming the [[Supreme Council of the Armed Forces|Egyptian military junta]] for calling them a "council of dogs". She was referred to a military court, prompting activists, as well as presidential hopefuls such as [[Mohamed ElBaradei]] and [[Ayman Nour]], to protest her being charged in a military court.<ref>Osman, Ahmed Zaki [http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/486440 Activists and presidential hopefuls condemn Asmaa Mahfouz arrest] al-Masry al-Youm. 15 August 2011</ref> Mahfouz was released on bail in the amount of 20,000 Egyptian Pounds, equivalent to approximately 3,350 US dollars.<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-14524094 Egypt blogger Mahfuz quizzed for 'defaming' military] BBC News. 14 August 2011</ref><ref>Osman, Ahmed Zaki [http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/486305 Activist released from military court on LE20,000 bail for Facebook post] al-Masry al-Youm. 14 August 2011</ref>
